thread.title: Victoria like a 'furnace' as state hit with heatwave
thread.title_full: Victoria like a 'furnace' as state hit with heatwave

author: James Hancock
title: Victoria like a 'furnace' as state hit with heatwave
text:
Geelong - 36C Warrnambool - 31C 
Melbourne hasa forecast top of 37C making it one of the city's hottest days this season. 
Mildura will experience the worst of the red-hot blast, with the mercury expected to climb to 44 degrees, along with other places in the Mallee. 
A total fire ban is in place for the Mallee, Wimmera and Central regions. 
Senior meteorologist Dr Chris Godfred from the Bureau of Meteorology said a wind change was pushing hot air from central Australia into the state. 
"We've had this fairly stagnant mass of air over the interior of the continent â€¦ the winds have turned northerly so some of that very hot air is now going to move across Victoria," he said. 
"The entire state gets a bit of a taste of the furnace."
